title: Boards needs a "Whine and Complain" Section
body: I'm getting sick and tired of these boards turning into a host for venting your childish rants because something isn't the way YOU want it to be. Some people actually go to these boards to have a laugh, share an idea, or maybe offer a CONSTRUCTIVE piece of advice to Riot. League has around (70 million?) players. Can you even fathom the amount of reports and complaints they get on a daily basis? They have people working around the clock, doing the best they can to please every one of you spoiled brats; yet, all you do is yell at them. Well I think they do pretty damn well. I propose a "Complaints" section on the boards in an attempt to funnel all the negativity into one page so us pleased customers can avoid the cranky ones.

Can you please elaborate on that? I always thought that if a champion feels like shit it's mostly likely because that champion is in fact shit.

In general, his is a case of outright power and control. He plays fine, for the most part, now after the reduced cast time on his E, but a bit clunky. His E was justifiably nerfed as a source of very long-range stuns that lasted for... a damn long time and were pretty easy to reliably land. However, with the change that, during the formation of his E, he stops dashes (not blinks), he still retains the clunkier feeling of the post-nerf E, but yet he is still fine despite that. 

It's not a popular opinion to hold that a champion is fine after a major ability is nerfed, but it's one that is, at this moment, a truth. Even if Annie or Riven were nerfed, whether necessary or not to placate the board's bloodlust (though, let's face it: if they were nerfed (again), the boards would be happy for 2 days then seek out another victim or go straight back to them; even if they were to be deleted they'd just move on to the next champion to complain about. It's been that way since before the Boards, and from what I understand, since before I started about halfway through Season One.) they would likely be just fine. Remember, this is a community that calls for reworks when _numbers_ are too high. This is a community that will claim a champion cannot be balanced because when a champion is nerfed then they become less played, as if that isn't the normal reaction people are going to have to nerfs, and that when they're buffed they're going to be overbearing as if there's any other goal other than to give them straight strength in a buff. 

To many, people feel Veigar feels shitty because of the E nerf and the DFG removal. They feel the Q buff doesn't make up for it, despite the fact that his E now immediately stuns people that attempt a dash out, trapping would-be targets in the ring or forcing a blink or flash. He feels "shitty" because an ability that was, by all accounts, fairly ludicrous, was nerfed and not given compensation that some people felt was appropriate, so because of that he feels like shit to some people despite the fact that he is fine, both numerically and power-wise. He isn't played a ton right now (about 2% according to champion.gg, placing him at a not bad but not great spot of 30/50 for mid laners) but at the same time, this also isn't a meta that hugely favors him, either. His winrate is at about 50% as well, so he doesn't really need any buffs, but he still feels like crap to play to some people who want the old Veigar back. You'll see it a lot - a champion that feels crappy or clunky to play as but doesn't need actual buffs, other than maybe QoL.

I off-main Veigar, and usually completely destroy with him; in which case, the only comments I hear are "No skill. That W must be sooo hard. Sweet *R* one shot," etc.. I didn't begin playing Veigar until after the rework, so he doesn't feel shitty to me. All of the sudden people go from complaining about being too weak due to nerfs, to being OP and unfair. There is no in between with this community =P
